senses.de: The main idea or topic in a piece of writing, discussion, or piece of work
senses.ex: The theme of the discussion was environmental conservation

Tips.title: Implicit Meaning
Tips.description: Sometimes the theme isn't directly mentioned but implied through characters and events.
Tips.example: In the novel, the theme of sacrifice is revealed through the protagonist's actions.

Tips.title: Universal Concepts
Tips.description: Themes often reflect universal ideas that many people can relate to.
Tips.example: The theme of friendship resonates in many cultures.

Tips.title: Discussion Focus
Tips.description: In discussions, stick to the theme to maintain a clear conversation direction.
Tips.example: Let's stay on theme and focus on climate change solutions.

senses.de: A tune or melody that is repeated in a musical composition
senses.ex: The main theme of the symphony was very catchy

Tips.title: Musical Identity
Tips.description: Musical themes provide a recognizable identity or mood for compositions.
Tips.example: John Williams' Star Wars theme is world-famous.

Tips.title: Repetition Variation
Tips.description: Themes in music often repeat with variations to keep the listener engaged.
Tips.example: The piano sonata's theme returned, each time with different harmonies.

senses.de: A subject, idea or concept that is consistently present in something
senses.ex: The theme of love is prevalent in Shakespeare's works

Tips.title: Subtextual Themes
Tips.description: Themes can act as subtext, providing deeper meanings beneath the surface story.
Tips.example: The movie's humor disguised its serious theme of social inequality.

Tips.title: Cultural Relevance
Tips.description: Themes can reflect the values or issues pertinent to a particular culture or time.
Tips.example: Her poems use local folklore to convey themes of heritage.

senses.de: The particular subject or idea on which the style of something is based on
senses.ex: They chose a tropical theme for the party

Tips.title: Consistent Aesthetics
Tips.description: A thematic style provides a consistent and harmonious aesthetic experience.
Tips.example: Each room's decor followed the Victorian theme of the hotel.

Tips.title: Event Planning
Tips.description: Choosing a clear theme for an event simplifies decorating and attire decisions.
Tips.example: Their wedding followed a 'Roaring Twenties' theme.

senses.de: A set of matching design elements, especially for a computer program interface
senses.ex: She changed the theme of her phone to a dark mode

Tips.title: Brand Identification
Tips.description: In computing, a theme helps create a distinctive look that can make a brand recognizable.
Tips.example: The app's minimalist theme aligns with its brand identity.

Tips.title: User Experience
Tips.description: Themes can be changed to suit user preferences, such as dark mode for night reading.
Tips.example: I prefer a dark theme to reduce glare on my screen.

Concept.wordDefinition:
Concept refers to a general idea or principle, while theme refers to a recurring idea or message in a work of art or literature.

For example, a concept could be "justice" or "love," which are broad ideas that can be applied to many different contexts.

In terms of applicability, concepts can be used in a variety of contexts, from business strategies to personal relationships.

Idea.wordDefinition:
An idea is a thought or concept that comes to your mind, while a theme is the underlying subject or central message of a work of art or literature.

Ideas are applicable in many situations such as problem-solving, brainstorming, or creativity while themes are more commonly used to describe and analyze literature, movies, or other works of art.

In simpler terms, an idea is what someone thinks while a theme is what a story is about.

Issue.wordDefinition:
Issue refers to a specific problem or topic that people are discussing or debating. For example, climate change is an issue that people are worried about.

So, while an issue is a specific problem or topic, a theme is a broader idea that is explored in various contexts.

Motif.wordDefinition:
A motif is a recurring symbol, image, or idea in a work that helps to reinforce the theme. It is a more specific element within a work that can help to deepen the reader's understanding of the theme.

A motif in that novel could be a particular object or symbol that represents family, such as a family heirloom that appears throughout the story.

The motif of the heirloom helps to reinforce the theme of the importance of family by highlighting the emotional connections between characters and their shared history.

A theme is the main idea of a work, while a motif is a recurring symbol or image that helps to reinforce the theme.

Premise.wordDefinition:
The premise of a story is the basic idea or concept behind it. For example, the premise of "Harry Potter" is a young orphan boy who discovers he is a wizard and attends a school for witches and wizards.

Both premise and theme are important elements in storytelling, but serve different purposes. The premise sets up the story and gives it direction, while the theme provides the deeper meaning and purpose behind the story.

Subject.wordDefinition:
The subject of a story or piece of writing is what the story is about, like the plot or the main idea. For example, the subject of a story could be about a person who overcomes a fearsome challenge.

The subject is the topic of the story, while the theme is the message or idea that the author hopes to convey through the story.

Thread.wordDefinition:
Thread, on the other hand, refers to a connecting idea or detail that runs throughout a story.

It can be a character trait, an object, or an event that is mentioned repeatedly. For example, a thread in a book might be a character always wearing a certain color, or a repeated reference to a particular tree.

Theme refers to the overall message or idea of a story, while thread refers to a specific detail or idea that connects different parts of the story.

Topic.wordDefinition:
Topic refers to the subject matter or specific aspect of the story that is being discussed or explored.

For example, if a novel is about a group of survivors navigating an apocalyptic world, the topic might be survivalism or the breakdown of society.

Theme is the overarching idea or message, while topic is the specific subject matter.

quotes.Text: One important theme is the extent to which one can ever correct an error, especially outside any frame of religious forgiveness. All of us have done something we regret - how we manage to remove that from our conscience, or whether that's even possible, interested me.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Ian Mcewan

quotes.Text: The fact that we are I don't know how many millions of people, yet communication, complete communication, is completely impossible between two of those people, is to me one of the biggest tragic themes in the world.
quotes.Title: Belgian Writer
quotes.Name: Georges Simenon

quotes.Text: I want readers turning pages until three o'clock in the morning. I want the themes of books to stick around for a reader. I'm always trying to find a way to balance characters and theme.
quotes.Title: Canadian Author
quotes.Name: Guy Gavriel Kay

quotes.Text: A theme in a lot of my books - and in my own life - is making choices that you feel you should make, or what society wants you to make, as opposed to what is truly right for you.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Emily Giffin

quotes.Text: My task is to tell a story with the music. I always like to have themes in terms of characters or plots, and things that can tell a story always interest me the most.
quotes.Title: German Composer
quotes.Name: Ramin Djawadi

quotes.Text: Anxiety and spiritual searching have been consistent themes with me, and that figures into my worldview. But I tend to make my songs sound like relationship songs.

quotes.Name: David Bowie

quotes.Text: If my life has had a theme, I suppose it has been a typical American theme in that, for most of it, I have been looking for happiness and success.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.Text: Parents fear for their children. Absolutely, I think it's a deep and troubling theme to explore.

quotes.Name: James Watkins

quotes.Text: You never write a theme for a movie thinking, 'This will live forever.

quotes.Name: John Williams

quotes.Text: Failure has been the great theme of my life, I think.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Philip Schultz
